page.title: Nominal Phrases - Degree Words
page.introduction: The top level of the nominal phrase is occupied by those degree words that modify the whole NP, such as just, only, and all, that were discussed and marked in the "Quantifiers and QP" section.

radioGroup.prompt: Does your language have these special words which modify the whole nominal phrase?
Where do these special degree words come with respect to the rest of the nominal phrase?
Can all the degree words of this type appear on either side of the nominal phrase?
radioGroup.radio: No, there are separate sets for each side

radioGroup.prompt: Can these special degree words appear on both sides in the same nominal phrase?
radioGroup.radio: No, only on one side or the other
Yes, and when present, they must appear on both sides
Yes, they may appear on both sides, but only the one in initial position is required

radioGroup.prompt: May a degree word also occur only phrase finally?

radioGroup.radio: Yes, they may appear on both sides, but only the one in final position is required

radioGroup.prompt: May a degree word also occur only phrase initially?

form.instruction: In the lexicon, mark those which can only occur initially with the feature DP-initial and those which can only occur finally with the feature DP-final. Do not enter either feature on any degree words which can occur on either side.
